intro: Pleroma martiusianum, commonly known as the Martiusian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, adapting to the harsh maritime climate. Its leaves are narrow and evergreen, contributing to its ornamental value. Pleroma martiusianum is a rare species, often found in specific microhabitats within its native range.
